newsitem.title: USA: KCBT HRW wheat ends lower, late rally cuts decline.
newsitem.headline: KCBT HRW wheat ends lower, late rally cuts decline.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures closed lower, but a late rebound from a technical support point trimmed declines, traders said.

September wheat slid to a session low of $3.60-1/2 per bushel in reaction to declines in CBOT soybeans and wheat futures markets, traders said. The $3.60-1/2 was the lowest September futures price since $3.57-1/2 was posted on July 22.
Profit taking plus buying of CBOT corn against selling of KCBT wheat weighed on KCBT wheat since midsession.
KCBT wheat traded higher early in reaction to reports of disease problems in North Dakota's spring wheat and to early gains in CBOT corn and soybean futures.
News of upcoming wheat tenders by Jordan and Morocco was anticipated and had little influence on prices, traders said.
KCBT HRW wheat closed down 1-1/2 to three cents with September off 2-1/2 at $3.64-1/2 per bushel.
